page.title: 09SCHOOL,PAST AND PRESENT.
page.content: We interviewed a man who has taught in Puddletown for 32 years.Many things have changed in that time. School was far more formal in the past where children would stand to answer a question.Fewer facilities meant that work was covered in greater depth.More subjects are offered in today's school. The influence of the Church was greater in the past.Each child was expected to learn the catechism by heart and the school attended church at festival time.Today,the influence of the Church is less obvious. In the modern school children have more freedom and often work in groups rather than as individuals.This was preferred by the interviewee.The present first school used to be an all age 5 to 15 school.Now we have a first and a middle school.
